intro: Micromeria persica, commonly known as Persian sandthrift, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal and inland desert environments. Micromeria persica is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to stabilize soil in harsh conditions.
